comments: "The spectrometer can be reserved for a maximum of 2 consecutive 15-minute blocks on Monday
popupwarning: and Thursday from 8 a.m. until 4 p.m. Between 4 p.m. and 7 p.m.
column13: it can be reserved only for maximum 15 minutes. After 7 p.m. the spectrometer can be reserved for any time period until the following morning 8 a.m.\r\n       On Wednesday and Friday
column14: it can be reserved for up to a 7 hour period between 8 a.m. and 4 p.m. From 4 p.m. until 7 p.m.
column15: it can be reserved only for maximum 15 minutes. After 7 p.m. it can be reserved for any time period until the following morning 8 a.m.\r\n       On Saturday
column16: the spectrometer can be reserved for a maximum of 4 consecutive 15-minute blocks from 8 a.m. until 6 p.m. After 6 p.m. it can be reserved for any time period until the following morning 8 a.m. On Sunday
column17: the spectrometer can be reserved for a maximum of 6 hours from 8 a.m. until 6 p.m. After 6 p.m. it can be reserved for any time period until the following morning 8 a.m.\r\n       The same user may use the instrument again only after at least 2 hours have passed since his/her previous use.\r\n"

column13: the spectrometer can be reserved for a maximum of 2 consecutive 15-minute blocks from 8 a.m. until 3 p.m. From 3 p.m. until 9 p.m. it can be reserved for a maximum of 2 hours. After 9 p.m. it can be reserved until 8 a.m. of the following day. \r\nOn Tuesday
column16: it can be reserved for a maximum of 2 consecutive 15-minute blocks from 8 a.m. until 5 p.m. After 5 p.m. it can be reserved continuously until 8 a.m. of the following day. \r\nOn Sunday
column17:
it can be reserved for a maximum of 8 consecutive 15-minute blocks from 8 a.m. until 5 p.m. After 5 p.m. it can be reserved continuously until 8 a.m. of the following day. 
The same user may use the instrument again after at least 2 hours have passed since his/her previous use.

"

comments: "The spectrometer can be reserved for a maximum of 2 consecutive 15-minute blocks on Monday
popupwarning: and Friday from 8 a.m. until 6 p.m. From 6 p.m. until 9 p.m. it can be used for a maximum of 4 consecutive 15-minute blocks
column13: and after 9 p.m. it can be reserved for any time period until the following morning at 8 a.m.\r\n\r\nThe Bruker 400 can be used for ordinary experiments every Tuesday until 1:00 pm. Simultaneously
column14: it can be reserved for maximum 2 hours from 9:00 am until 1:00 pm. After 1:00 pm
column15:
the spectrometer will be set for diffusion experiments until the following day (Wednesday) 9:00 am. When the Bruker 400 is configured for diffusion experiments there is no time limit for its reservation.

On Thursday it can be reserved for up to a 6 hour period between 8 a.m. and 9 p.m. After 9 p.m. it can be reserved for any time period until the following morning at 8 a.m.

On Saturday
column16: it can be reserved for a maximum of 2 consecutive 15-minute blocks from 8 a.m. until 2 p.m. From 2 p.m. until 9 p.m. it can be used for a maximum of 4 hours
column17: and after 9 p.m. it can be reserved for any time period until the following morning at 8 a.m.\r\n\r\nOn Sunday
column18: it can be reserved for a maximum of 4 consecutive 15-minutes blocks from 8 a.m. until 5 p.m. After 5 p.m.
column19: it can be reserved continuously until 8 a.m. on Monday.  \r\nThe same user may use the instrument again only after at least 2 hours have passed since his/her previous use. \r\n"

comments: "This spectrometer can be used for a maximum of 15 minutes on Monday through Saturday
warnings: from 8 a.m. until 5 p.m. From 5 p.m. until 9 p.m. it can be used for a maximum of 2 consecutive 15-minute blocks. After 9 p.m. it can be used continuously until 8 a.m. of the following day. On Sunday
popupwarning: it can be used for a maximum of 2 consecutive 15-minut blocks from 8 a.m. until 9 p.m. and after 9 p.m. it can be used continuously until 8 a.m. on Monday. The same user may use the instrument again only after at least 2 hours have passed since his/her previous use."

comments: The instrument can be reserved for up to a 144 hours period during week. The period can be extended if no more time is requested. It is assumed that the minimum reserved time will be 1 hour. \r\nNo walk on.

The spectrometer is designated for measurements of heteronuclear CP MAS spectra of solids. It can be reserved for up to a 72 hours period during week. The period can be extended as needed if no other user wants to use it.
